uqa.context_utils module¶

Data classes.

Context class stores context’s raw text, processing steps outputs and meta data.
Label class stores any extra information about a span of text.
LabelNode class extends Label to represent hierarchical information on a raw text such as Constituency parsing results.

The classes implement features for easy manipulation, visualization and IO operations.

uqa.context_utils.yellow(text: str) → str[source]¶

Enclose and return text str with ASCII yellow color espace sequence.

uqa.context_utils.blue(text: str) → str[source]¶

Enclose and return text str with ASCII blue color espace sequence.

uqa.context_utils.red(text: str) → str[source]¶

Enclose and return text str with ASCII red color espace sequence.

uqa.context_utils.colorize(text: str, color: str)[source]¶

Colorize and return text with color color.

Use ASCII color escape sequence and will only display properly on terminal supporting those espace sequence.

Parameters

color (str) – Has to be one of: black, red, green, yellow, blue, magenta, cyan, white

class uqa.context_utils.Label(start: int, end: int, label: str, **extras: Any)[source]¶

Bases: uqa.context_utils._SimpleRepr

Represent label span of text defined by its start and end indices and a label string.

Label instances also have an extras attribute to hold any other characteristic, such as color for printing purpose.

Implements order operators so that sorting a list of labels returns label with increasing start indices and from the outermost label to inner most label.

Two labels are equals if they have the same start, end indices and label.

The in operator returns True is the left operand label is (strictly or not) included in the right operand label.

Also implement dictionnary like attribute accessor for convinience.

start¶

start index of the label

Type

int

end¶

end index of the label

Type

int

label¶

label category

Type

string

extras¶

holds extra informations such as color for pretty printing.

Type

Dict[str, Any]

Parameters

  • start (int) – start index of the label

  • end (int) – end index of the label

  • label (string) – label category

Keyword Arguments

extras – Stored as extras entries

classmethod from_json(jsonlike: MutableMapping) → uqa.context_utils.LabelNode[source]¶

Instaciate and return an LabelNode instance from a json-like data structure.

jsonlike keys name must match the attribute names, any extra field content will be stored in extras.

flat_iter() → Iterable[uqa.context_utils.LabelNode][source]¶

Iterate the sub tree defined by this node from lowest to biggest (relative to Label order).

The first label yielded is always the instance bounded.

to_label() → uqa.context_utils.Label[source]¶

Returns a Label instance containing the same start, end and extras values.

copy(depth=- 1)[source]¶

Return a deep-copy of this instance.

Parameters

depth (int, default=-1) – The depth to which the copy is done, if negative the entire hierarchy is copied, if 0, similar to self.copy_no_child()

Returns

LabelNode – The new copied instance.

copy_no_child(**extras: Any) → uqa.context_utils.LabelNode[source]¶

Copy this instance without copying its children.

Keyword Arguments

extras – Udpate the copied instance extras dictionnary

classmethod from_labels(labels: Iterable[uqa.context_utils.Label]) → List[uqa.context_utils.LabelNode][source]¶

Build and return a list LabelNode hierarchies from labels iterable.

Parameters

labels (Iterable of Label) – An iterable of labels either included in ou distinct from one another.

Returns

list of LabelNode – The forest (graph theory) made of labels in labels iterable as a list of the roots of each tree.

uqa.context_utils.set_color_all(label_iterable: Iterable[Label], color: str) → None[source]¶

Set the color color to all labels in label_iterable, if the iterable contains a label node set the color to the whole hierarchy

uqa.context_utils.set_color_hier(label_nodes: Union[uqa.context_utils.LabelNode, Iterable[uqa.context_utils.LabelNode]], colors: Optional[List[str]] = None, depth_offset: int = 0) → None[source]¶

Cycle through colors and assign a color to each labels in label_nodes and their hierarchy depending to their depth.

Parameters

  • label_node (LabelNode or Iterable of LabelNode) – a single LabelNode or an iterable of LabelNode

  • colors – List of colors to use

  • depth_offset – The depth offset of the label(s) in label_nodes, the first color used is colors[depth_off % len(colors)].

class uqa.context_utils.QA[source]¶

Bases: tuple

A question / answer pair of labels, the question is a string while the answer is a Label

class uqa.context_utils.Context(fpath: str, doc_id: int, doc_title: str, context_id: int, text: str, ner: Iterable[uqa.context_utils.Label] = (), constituents: Iterable[uqa.context_utils.LabelNode] = (), qas: Iterable[uqa.context_utils.QA] = ())[source]¶

Bases: uqa.context_utils._SimpleRepr

Represent a context and its computed features.

fpath¶

The file from which this context was red from

Type

str

doc_id¶

The context’s document (article) id

Type

int

doc_title¶

The context’s document title

Type

str

context_id¶

The context’s index in its document

Type

int

text¶

The context raw text

Type

str

ner¶

The list of computed named entities.

Type

Iterable of Label

constituents¶

The forest of constituent as a list of LabelNode; each root is a sentence in the text.

Type

Iterable of LabelNode

qas¶

The list of generated question answer pairs

Type

Iterable of QA

classmethod from_json(data: Dict) → uqa.context_utils.Context[source]¶

Instanciate a context from json-like data structure with keys matching this class attributes names.

The classmethod cast sub-dictionnaries of data into the appropriate types Label, LabelNode and QA.

set_color_all(attr_name: str, color: str) → None[source]¶

Calls set_color_all() on the attribute named attr_name with color.

set_color_hier(attr_name: str, colors: Optional[List[str]] = None) → None[source]¶

Calls set_color_hier() on the attribute named attr_name with colors.

header(color: Union[str, Tuple[str, str], None] = None) → str[source]¶

Returns a string with the file path in the first line and the article id, title and the context id in the second line.

Parameters

color (None, str, or pair of str, default=None) –

If None, no coloring is applied,
if one color is passed, colorize both lines with it
if a pair of colors is passed colorize each line with one the colors.

uqa.context_utils.decorate_span(text_span: str, label: uqa.context_utils.Label, template: str = '[{label} {txt}]') → str[source]¶

Decorate the whole text_span with label following the template.

If label contains a color entry in its Label.extras attribute, the color is applied to all characters but the text_span.
Label.start and Label.end are ignored.
Parameters

  • text_span (str) – Piece of text to decorate

  • label (Label) – A Label or LabelNode instance

  • template (str, default="[{label} {txt}]") – A template str with placeholders {label} and {txt}

Returns

str – text_span decorated with label according to the template

uqa.context_utils.decorate(text: str, labels: Iterable, template: str = '[{label} {txt}]', autocoloring=False, show_no_label=False) → str[source]¶

Decorate text with labels according to the template.

Parameters

  • text (str) – The text to decorate

  • labels (Iterable) – An recursivesly iterable container where all leaves are either Label, LabelNode or dict representing a Label.

  • format (str) – template for the decoration part must contains placeholders {label} and {txt}.

  • autocoloring (bool, default=False) – If True override color extras setting with cyclic coloring of the label.

  • show_no_label (bool, default=False) – If False don’t use labels with empty label value.

Returns

str – The decorated colorized string

Notes

labels must be either nested in or distinct from one another.

uqa.context_utils.contextify(data_it: Iterable[Tuple[str, Union[Dict, List]]]) → Iterable[uqa.context_utils.Context][source]¶

Extract and yield Context instances from default structre iterable data_it.

uqa.context_utils.contextify_rd(data_it) → Iterable[uqa.context_utils.Context][source]¶

Extract and shuffle and yield Context instances from default structre iterable data_it.

Shuffling is done per file content.

uqa.context_utils.jsonify(context_it: Iterable[uqa.context_utils.Context], include_qas: bool = True) → Iterable[Tuple[str, Union[Dict, List]]][source]¶

Reverse operation of conetxtify(), recrate a dataset iterable from an ordered context_it.

context_it must yield context in the order it was created by contextify().

Parameters

  • context_it (Iterable of Context) – Context iterable

  • include_qas (bool, default=True) – If False discard Context.qas values.
